qas.question: Under whose occupation did Portugal begin a slow decline?
How long did Portugal's decline last?
In what year did Brazil become independent from Portugal?
To where did Prince Regent Joao VI of Portugal transfer his court?
What was the name of the pluricontinental state formed by Portugal and Brazil in 1815?

answers.text: United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves

context: With the occupation by <a0_0>Napoleon<a0_0/>, Portugal began a slow but inexorable decline that lasted <a1_0>until the 20th century<a1_0/>. This decline was hastened by the independence in <a2_0>1822<a2_0/> of the country's largest colonial possession, Brazil. In 1807, as Napoleon's army closed in on Lisbon, the Prince Regent João VI of Portugal transferred his court to <a3_0>Brazil<a3_0/> and established Rio de Janeiro as the capital of the Portuguese Empire. In 1815, Brazil was declared a Kingdom and the Kingdom of Portugal was united with it, forming a pluricontinental State, the <a4_0>United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves<a4_0/>.
